--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "legatusbiz" <legatusbiz@y...>
wrote:
> 
> Hello Mr. J,
> Thank you very much for your help. 
> First of all I'm not a linux user, but I'm learning.
> When execting heratrix I now recieve this error-message -
> 
> "# ./heritrix
> Sun Mar 27 17:10:01 CEST 2005 Starting heritrix
> org.mortbay.util.MultiException[java.net.BindException: Address
> already in use]
>         at org.mortbay.http.HttpServer.start(HttpServer.java:640)
>         at

Well, this is what OpenSource community is for.  You have to thank to
the guys from IA without them, there will be no Heritrix at all. 
Okie, back to work, this error is purely your machine.  Maybe one of
the instances are still running so the port is binded.  You have two
solution to solve, find and killall the process running for that port
or  just simply restart the machine will fix it.  To kill those
process, assuming it is one of the leftover of heritrix, "killall
herirtrix" or "killall java" (if you don't have anyother java process
on the machine).

Laters,
Jay
